intro: Microcos subcordifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microcos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions.
